fields.description:
h3. Summary

When users attempt to link a Story of non next-Gen project with *Epic* of Next-Gen project, Jira still shows them in the list of possible Epics to be links. However, since Epic from next-Gen project has no Epic Name, it shows as *unlabelled-issue key* and has below error.
{quote}
Issue 'issue key' must be of type 'Epic'.
{quote} 

From users' perspective, this is Epic issue type from next-gen project and they don't expect this to be much difference from other Epics. With the above error message returned, it is confusing users.

h3. Steps to reproduce

# Have 2 projects (Next-gen and non next-gen)
# Create an Epic from Next-gen project
# Create a Story from non next-gen project
# Edit the Story and try to link it from Edit Issue screen
# Update

h3. Expected Result

This seems not currently possible to do this crossed project linking between Next-gen and non next-gen project. Below are the proposed solution/expected behavior:

# Update our documentation about this limitation
# Epics from Next-gen projects should not be returned in the list of Epics, when users attempt to link it from non Next-gen project
# Provide clearer error message that users can't link with Epic from Next-gen project

h3. Actual Result

Below error message is shown:
*  !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Provide clearer message when users link Story from non next-gen project with Epic of next-gen project

h3. Summary

For next-gen projects, when on the Roadmaps page, entering a long description (255 characters) or long name (60 characters) while trying to create an epic issue type breaks the page.
 This situation can occur if a project does not have an epic issue type, or their epic issue type was removed.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Navigate to a next-gen project
 # Navigate to the roadmap within that project
 # If no epic issue type, land on the healthcheck page
 # Click "Add epic issue type"
 # Click "Add a new issue type"
 # Enter a description in the description field of more than 255 characters OR
 # Enter a description in the name field of more than 60 characters

h3. Expected Results
 * An epic issue type will be created and the user will be navigated to their Roadmap

h3. Actual Results
 * An error flag appears and a user is unable to use their Roadmap

h3. Workaround
 # Do not enter a description length greater than 255 characters
 # Do not enter a name length greater than 60 characters

fields.description:
{panel:title=Atlassian status as of October 2021|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#b2d4ff|titleBGColor=#b2d4ff|bgColor=#eaf1fc}
Hello all,

Thank you for watching, voting, and commenting on this issue. We appreciate your input and patience.

Running multiple sprints in parallel from a single backlog is something we will bring to team-managed projects. However, we have some other priorities ahead of it, we are currently not able to give a date, but I expect we will start to work on this in the coming months.

In the short term, we recommend teams use company-managed projects when they need to run parallel sprints. We apologise for the inconvenience this may cause you.

Please continue to vote, and in particular, please continue to add comments on how your teams find value when running multiple sprints in parallel from a single backlog. This contextual information of what you are doing and why you are doing it is invaluable for providing you with a product that fits your needs.

Thank you,
Mark Z
Product Manager
{panel}
h3. Problem Definition

Currently, we have the ability to enable Sprints in Next-gen projects. However, we couldn't allow Parallel Sprints even we had enabled it in Jira Software Configuration.
h3. Suggested Solution
 * Implement the ability to execute multiple sprints in parallel from one backlog
fields.summary: Parallel Sprints in team-managed projects

fields.description:
h2. Summary

When a Project key is changed in JIRA, the original key remains stored in the database, this allows any commits done in the past to the Issue to appear in the Development panel once synced.

This also allows new commits using the old Project key to appear in the Development panel of the Issue, disregarding what the new Issue key is.

 !OMG-1__2_unique_commits_-_Jira.png|thumbnail! 

For organisations who undergo a change in infrastructure where the removal of any past data is required, this poses a problem as they cannot "break" this synchronisation with the previous commits in the old Issue key.

h2. Solution

In JIRA, introduce the option for site-admins to block any past and new commits or any data relevant to the Development panel linked to the previous Project key to only use the new Project key going forward.
fields.summary: Un-syncing past commits for changed Project keys

fields.description:
I just spent an hour and a half trying to work out why certain epics weren't displaying in the Epics panel of my backlog.

Most of this time was spent searching here and in the community for "Why aren't my Epics displaying in backlog" or "How to set which Epics appear in the backlog". 

I couldn't find anything that addressed my issue.

Eventually I discovered something I had never known before (I have been using Jira for nearly 10 years) :
 * There are two types of status: *Epic Status* and *Issue Status* and it appears these two are completely unrelated.

That is, if I'm editing an Epic, changing Issue Status has no effect on Epic Status and vice versa.

This is really confusing – especially as Epic Status does not display by default on the Epic Issue edit form. 

Also, if I set the Issue Status of an Epic, shouldn't that set the Epic Status and vice versa?

What is the meaning of Issue Status for an Epic?

This needs to be clarified both on the form itself and in the documentation.
fields.summary: Epic Status vs Issue Status confusing

fields.description:
h3. Summary

By default and part of the rollout for the Estimation for Next-Gen projects, Jira now has two Story Points field.
 # Story Points
 # Story points estimate

||id||customfieldtypekey||cfname||
|10015|com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.customfieldtypes:float|Story point estimate|
|10021|com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.customfieldtypes:float|Story Points|

The default field that is used by Jira classic projects is the field Story Points.

If you, when using the Jira old view, add the Story point estimate (Next-Gen estimation) field and assign the number for the story point, this field does not work and the number is not displayed on the cards or at the new issue view or in the reports.
h3. Steps to Replicate
 # Click on Jira Icon on the top left corner > Jira Settings > Issues
 # On the left side-bar, click on Screen.
 # At the bottom of the field lists, enter "Story" on the field selection.
 !Screenshot 2019-04-03 at 2.50.54 PM.png|width=487,height=294!

h3. Expected behavior

As the new field is exclusive for Next-Gens projects, it is necessary to block this field usage to prevent miss assignments or miss usage of this field, blocking its usage in classic projects.
h3. Actual behavior

On the board, the assign number for story point isn't rendered:

!Screenshot 2019-04-04 at 7.40.07 AM.png|width=742,height=333!

In Report View, the story point will display as null value:

  !Screenshot 2019-04-04 at 7.50.43 AM.png|width=723,height=455!

h3. Workaround
Assign the field "Story Point" instead of "Story Point Estimate" on Classic project's screen.
fields.summary: One story point field across team-managed projects and company-managed projects

When board's filter contains a field and one of its value deleted, the Card Color won't show anything in all issues within a board.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

#* {noformat}project = ABC AND fruits in (Apple, Banana, Orange) ORDER BY Rank ASC {noformat}
# Create a new board using the above filter
# Change the Card Color setting to _Queries_
# Use any JQL (ie Component = Blue, issuetype=Story) > Add
#* The Card Colors should show up now

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently it's not possible to access permissions schemes or manage permissions for specific actions in next-gen projects. Some of the permissions (e.g 'Add Comment', 'Work On Issues') are granted to all the users who have access to the project. However, some permissions (e.g 'View All Worklogs') are not granted to any user even the admins. This causes some pains, for example admins can't see the worklogs added by other users.

h3. Suggested Solution
Implement the ability to manage permissions (or permission scheme) in next-gen projects.
fields.summary: Ability to manage permissions in next-gen projects

fields.description:
{panel:title=Status Update 11th May 2020|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#ff7f7f|titleBGColor=#ff7f7f|bgColor=#e5e5e5}

Hello Everyone,

We are happy to announce that the ability to customize the configuration of email notifications on next-gen projects is now available on all JSW and JSD next-gen projects. 

More details can be found at [https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Jira-articles/Announcement-Project-Level-Email-Notifications-for-next-gen/ba-p/1374538]

We hope this enables our customers to further optimize which email notifications are sent out to users and we look forward to your feedback.

 

Thank you!
Arjoon Som
Senior Product Manager

{panel}
 

{panel:title=Status Update 9th September 2019|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#ff7f7f|titleBGColor=#ff7f7f|bgColor=#e5e5e5}

 Hi everyone,

My name's Shweta and I'm a Product Manager working on improving Jira's email notification experience. As a part of that, we had rolled out the new batched experience ([https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirasoftwarecloud/blog/2019/02/jira-emails-are-changing?_ga=2.173668899.1017345967.1562555521-706473354.1537750122])  - to reduce the number of emails you get. 
  

Our team is currently working through providing notification settings to all users.  We've already gotten a bunch of awesome responses the surveys and feedback we've asked through this issue. The good news is we have our first version of that ready to be tested. 
  
 If you have some time, it'll be great if you can test out the first settings we've built out. It's still in Beta and your feedback can help improve it further. You can sign up for the Beta here - [https://forms.gle/g6Qqt3dkC7eMB1mA8]

Please let me know if you have any questions or concerns.  

  Thanks,
 Shweta 

{panel}


h3. Problem definition

Currently managing notifications or accessing to notification scheme is not available in next-gen projects. All users involved in the issues (e.g Watcher, Assignee and Reporter) are receiving email notifications for all updates, and admins are unable to add more recipients or customise the notifications for existing recipients.
h3. Resolution suggested

Provide the ability to manage notifications in next-gen projects.
fields.summary: Ability to manage notifications in Next-gen projects

fields.description:
h3. Description:
 * Clicking on *Edit*, changing a field or not, creates an empty *Sprint* update record in the *Activity* section. 
 * This problem may cause undesired notifications to be sent, in case the user is configured to receive *Issue Updated* messages, for an example.
 

h3. How to reproduce:
 * Whenever an issue that is located in the *Backlog* has its rank updated, Jira creates an empty record of sprint update in the issue's History. To reproduce this bug, the required steps are:
 # Open a project's Backlog 
 # Open an issue on a new window
 # Click on *Edit*
 #* Edit a field or not
 # Click on *Update*
 # Open the issue and check its *History*

h3. Expected results:
 * Only a single entry, referencing the to  the update, should have been recorded

h3. Actual results:
 * An entry referencing a *Sprint* update is also recorded, although there are neither old values nor new ones.
 !Screen Shot 2018-10-01 at 5.03.07 PM.png|thumbnail! 
 *  !Screen Shot 2019-05-07 at 13.09.33.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Editing issue on backlog creates empty Sprint field update record

fields.description:
{panel:title= News|titleBGColor=#e0efff}
(i)
*UPDATED*: [Sub-tasks|https://www.atlassian.com/roadmap/jira-software#results] are now available for most customers. You can learn more about it by reading this blogpost: [https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Next-gen-articles/Introducing-subtasks-to-work-breakdown-in-next-gen/ba-p/1105389].

Please note that we have rolled out subtasks to almost all instances and we are in the process of completing the remainder of the rollout. If you are unable to add the subtask issue type, then don't worry it's coming very soon to your instance.
{panel}
h3. Problem Definition

The customer does not have an option to add an issue type: *Sub-task* in the current set of *Next-gen projects*.
 The customer can create a custom issue type *Sub-task*, however, this does not solve the purpose of it.
h3. Suggested Solution

Currently, there are no direct solutions as such, customers will have to create a non Next-gen project to use issue type *Sub-task* in their projects
h3. Workaround

As [next-gen|https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Next-gen-articles/Everything-you-want-to-know-about-next-gen-projects-in-Jira/ba-p/894773] project focuses on providing an easier experience to get started, please consider using classic project.

Refer to the document [Migrate between next-gen and classic projects|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirasoftwarecloud/migrate-from-a-next-gen-project-to-a-classic-project-957974933.html] if you have some tickets on next-gen and need to migrate them to classic project.
fields.summary: No option to add a issue type "sub-task" for next-gen projects

fields.description:
As a Jira Software user, I want a feature which allows me to quickly change the order of the issues in the backlog view.

It would be useful to have column headers in the backlog view only the users could just click on and the issues in the backlog would be sorted.

Also, the quick filter would allow the usage of the "ORDER BY" clause, once for now it always enforces the board's filter order by clause.
fields.summary: As a Jira Software user, I want a feature which allows me to quickly change the order of the issues in the backlog view

fields.description:
{panel:title=Atlassian status as of June 2020|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#b2d4ff|titleBGColor=#b2d4ff|bgColor=#eaf1fc}
Hello all, 
Thank you for watching, voting, and commenting on this ticket.
We understand that having the two fields that are conceptually the same thing is easily confusing and an undesirable experience. 
As this ticket is a duplicate of JSWCLOUD-17173, we are closing this ticket so that we can aggregate the feedback on a single ticket. 
Cheers,
Emily Chan
Product Manager, Atlassian.

P.S.: if you’d like to understand the cause that led us to having these two fields, please see [this earlier comment|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSWCLOUD-17152?focusedCommentId=1904509&page=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issuetabpanels:comment-tabpanel#comment-1904509].
{panel}
h3. Summary

The *Story points* field appear as *Story point estimate* in the new issue view.

!_SCRUM-5__865_-_JIRA.png|thumbnail!

!_SCRUM-5__865_-old_JIRA.png|thumbnail!
h3. Notes

These are still 2 different fields, the naming just appears differently for sites with the new *Story point estimate* field enabled.

Also, from JSWCLOUD-17173:
{quote}By default and part of the rollout for the Estimation for Next-Gen projects, Jira now has two Story Points field.
 # Story Points
 # Story points estimate

||id||customfieldtypekey||cfname||
|10015|com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.customfieldtypes:float|Story point estimate|
|10021|com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.customfieldtypes:float|Story Points|

The default field that is used by Jira classic projects is the field Story Points.

If you, when using the Jira old view, add the Story point estimate (Next-Gen estimation) field and assign the number for the story point, this field does not work and the number is not displayed on the cards or at the new issue view or in the reports.
{quote}
h3. Workaround

Edit the issue view screen for the project and remove the un-necessary field.

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When there is a special character in project name (For example {{#}}) JIRA fails to generate reports.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a new Scrum software development project with the name {{Test C#}}.
# Try to create a "Created vs. Resolved Issues Report" in the newly created project.

h3. Expected Results
JIRA displays the configuration page for the report.

h3. Actual Results
The below error is thrown in UI:
 !2016-10-12_report_config.png|thumbnail! 
 
h3. Notes
The error is due to URL encoding.
JIRA is using the following URL to request the configuration page without encoding the special character in the URL :
{{http://<JIRA base URL>/secure/ConfigureReport!default.jspa?selectedProjectId=10100&projectOrFilterId=project-10100&projectOrFilterName=Test%20C#&reportKey=com.atlassian.jira.jira-core-reports-plugin:createdvsresolved-report}}

h3.Workaround
Manually encoding the project name in URL by changing {{#}} to {{%23}}
fields.summary: Special character in project name causes "Configure Report - Error"

h1. HTTP Status 500 – Internal Server Error
----
*Type* Exception Report

*Message* com.google.common.util.concurrent.UncheckedExecutionException: com.netflix.hystrix.exception.HystrixRuntimeException: TenantContextCommand short-circuited and fallback failed.

fields.summary: JIRA CLoud broken
No Scroll bar displays in Bug Home screen in Chrome (Version 69.0.3497.100)

fields.description:
h3. Summary

On boards that have disabled ranking, dragging of cards is restricted within the borders of the boards. This is not user friendly on extra size cards and columns with multiple transition options.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a board and disable the ranking
 # Add some additional fields on the card layout to increase the size of the card
 # Set a column to have multiple transition statuses (3 statuses)
 # Drag the card on the top right corner and try to drag to the 3rd status on the target column

h3. Expected Results

The mouse pointer should be allowed to reach the third option and complete the move.

!allowed.png|thumbnail!
h3. Actual Results

The card is restricted within the borders of the columns and the mouse pointer cannot reach the third option.

!border.png|thumbnail!
h3. Workaround

Go to the board's settings and enable ranking.
fields.summary: Dragging of cards is restricted on board without ranking.

fields.description:
Currently, when you right-click a story card in the board's active sprint view, the option "Remove from sprint" only allows you to move that story to another sprint if you have other sprints (active or future) in the backlog view. This can cause scope changing problems and can impact unrelated sprints.

As a Jira Software user, I want to be able to remove a story from an active sprint and send it directly to the backlog by right-clicking the story card in the active sprint view.
fields.summary: As a Jira Software user, I want to be able to move a story back to backlog by right-clicking the card in the "Active Sprint" view

fields.description:
Is this a bug/ glitch or did I miss something in settings? Why is everything missing but the issues? Where is the title, the save as button, the details button and the search bar?

Jira -> search button (magnifying glass) -> view all issues. Takes you to this page (Issue navigator).

 

+*What it looks like:*+

!https://tnckb94959.i.lithium.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/8264i0B8379E770E52CF6/image-dimensions/2000?v=1.0&px=-1!

 

+*What it should look like:*+

*!https://tnckb94959.i.lithium.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/8263iB9B3DADBE7DCCFDB/image-dimensions/2000?v=1.0&px=-1!*

 

**I use filters quiet extensively and now can't use the advanced search option at all. This was working fine last night (8/27/18), I open it up today (8/28/18) and it looks glitched out. Please help!
fields.summary: Issue navigator - Advanced search bar missing

fields.description:
After the latest UI change, now when I click on an issue from the backlog view, I see the Epic Link at the top followed by the ticket number.

 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: As a user, I would like that the epic link be displayed as a field and not as a top-link at the issue number

fields.description:
h3. Description
By having a project with a single board all the options are displayed without a line category divider. If a project has two boards associated to it, it will display a divider line between Reports and Releases options

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a software project
# Access the new project and check the left side panel menu, options will be displayed like below:
 !screenshot-2.png|thumbnail! 
# Create a new board only and associate to this project, by accessing the project again, the left side panel menu, the options will be now displayed with a divider line:
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 

Video reproducing: https://cl.ly/97d514c6ecf4

h3. Expected Behavior
Whenever if the project has one board or more boards, the UI should be consistent and show the divider line

h3. Actual Behavior
The divider line only shows when having a project with 2+ boards

h3. Workaround
No workaround
fields.summary: UI bug - Project with one board does not have divider line

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Time Tracking Reports not displaying proper times in French

h3. Environment
* Jira Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Set your language preference to French 
# Browse to any Time Tracking Report in a project
# Observe the issue

h3. Expected Results

Proper variables being reflected in the report

h3. Actual Results
The variables are displaying as {0} or {1} instead

h3.Workaround
Change profile language to English
fields.summary: Time Tracking Reports not displaying proper times in French

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Users without administrator permissions can create Kanban and Scrum boards.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 * Create a new user.
 * Grant JIRA Software access to this user.
 * Log in as the user.
 * Open the view all boards page.
 * Select create board.

h3. Expected Results
 * According to [Creating a board|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirasoftwarecloud/creating-a-board-764477949.html].
 * Only people with administrator permissions can create Scrum and Kanban boards.

h3. Actual Results
 * Any user with JIRA Software access can create Kanban and Scrum boards.
fields.summary: Users without administrator permissions can create Kanban and Scrum boards.

fields.description:
Recent changes in the board view in JSW Cloud compacted quick filters in a drop-down list:

  !quick filters.png!

The old style buttons were much more practical, as they required fewer clicks. Please bring the buttons back and create a way of having radio-buttons for quick filters, so when you choose one, the other is de-selected automatically, similar to the request in https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSWSERVER-12448
fields.summary: bring back the quick filters buttons

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Unable to fully delete Agility project from UI

h3. Steps to Reproduce
* Delete Agility project from project settings
 !agility2.JPG|thumbnail! 

h3. Expected Results
* Project deleted successfully

h3. Actual Results
* UI throws an error
 !agile.JPG|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Unable to delete Agility project

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
*NOTE:* This suggestion is for {*}JIRA Software Cloud{*}. Using {*}JIRA Software Server{*}? See the corresponding suggestion.
{panel}
Currently, Kanban and Scrum boards on Jira Cloud have the feature to right-Click on the Issue Card and select the "Add Flag"/"Remove Flag" option. This gives a pop-up that shows the Flag and a Comment box to enter a comment. (Check the image below)
!screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 
After we enter the comment and click {*}ADD{*}, this flags the issue as an impediment and automatically adds the Red Flag icon to the comments, or removes the impediment and automatically adds the White Flag icon to the comments.

This feature, however, is not available on the New issue view screen. Inside the New issue view screen, it is only possible to select "Add Flag" / "Remove Flag" from the Ellipses (... 3dots) *Menu* and it will directly mark the issue as {color:#ff0000}*flagged*{color} or remove the flag.
 * The problem here is that this is not consistent with the flow that the Add and Remove Flag operation takes when it is done from the Board Issue Cards. When adding a flag from the board issue cards it gives a Pop-Up window with the *Comment* Field and adds the entry in the comment with the Flag Icon.
 !screenshot-2.png|thumbnail!  !screenshot-3.png|thumbnail! 
 * When adding the flag from the New Issue Detail View, the issue is flagged, but the comment does not get updated with the Flag Icon.

Please make both the flow consistent in the way they work so the results are similar. This would speed up the flagging and unflagging of issues, and since it is a feature already present in JIRA, it shouldn't be too difficult to make it available from inside the view screen.
fields.summary: Provide the ability to add a comment when adding flag or remove the flag to an issue using the New Issue View Menu options

fields.description:
Able to get results when I call directly from web browser: [https://jiracielo.atlassian.net/rest/api/3/search?jql=project%20in%20(CRD,%20%22Squad%20Farol%22,%20%22Squad%20Apollo%20(APP)%22,%20%22Squad%20Rentabilidade%22,%20%22Harley%20Davidson%20(Squad%20HD)%22,%20%22Venda%20de%20Solu%C3%A7%C3%B5es%20de%20Captura%22,%20%22SQUAD%20-%20Pr%C3%A9-Pago%22,%20SIGOTRIX,%20%22Squad%20POS%202018%22)%20AND%20issuetype%20in%20(Block,%20Risk,%20kaizen,%20Incident)%20OR%20project%20=%20SSWET%20AND%20%22Frente%20de%20Entrega%22%20in%20(%22Star%20Trek%22,%20%22Star%20Wars%22)%20AND%20issuetype%20in%20(Block,%20Risk,%20kaizen,%20Incident)&startAt=0&maxResults=100]   But when I try to call via GET from my application, I receive the error: HTTP Status 400 – Bad Request

Note The full stack trace of the root cause is available in the server logs.
Apache Tomcat/9.0.10


 

It used to be working last Friday (September 14th). Below you can see how do we call the Rest Service. 

 

 

query = project in (CRD, "Squad Farol", "Squad Apollo (APP)", "Squad Rentabilidade", "Harley Davidson (Squad HD)", *"Venda de Soluções de Captura"*, *"SQUAD - Pré-Pago"*, SIGOTRIX, "Squad POS 2018") AND issuetype in (Block, Risk, kaizen, Incident) OR project = SSWET AND "Frente de Entrega" in ("Star Trek", "Star Wars") AND issuetype in (Block, Risk, kaizen, Incident)

servidor = [https://jiracielo.atlassian.net|https://jiracielo.atlassian.net/]

 I identified in bold the text that cause de error. When I remove both, the GET service return code 200. If there is any special char in the query, the error return code 400.

Public Function GetIssues(query As String) As String

Dim JiraService As New MSXML2.XMLHTTP60
 Dim json As Object
 Dim s As String
 Dim Servidor As String

Servidor = (Range("Jira_Server").Value)
 vrLimPagina = 100
 With JiraService
 s = Servidor + "/rest/api/2/search?jql=" + query + "&startAt=" + CStr(vrCursor) + "&maxResults=" + _
 CStr(vrLimPagina) + "&fields=*all"
 .Open "GET", s
 .setRequestHeader "Content-Type", "application/json"
 .setRequestHeader "Accept", "application/json"
 .setRequestHeader "Authorization", "No Auth"
 .send

If .Status = "404" Then
 fStatus.AppendStatus ("Erro ao conectar no Jira, : " + .responseText)
 GetIssues = ""
 Else
 If .Status = "200" Then
 fStatus.AppendStatus ("Conexão realizada com sucesso")
 GetIssues = JiraService.responseText
 Else
 fStatus.AppendStatus ("Erro na obtenção de de dados : " + .responseText)
 GetIssues = ""
 End If
 End If
 End With

End Function
fields.summary: Special Char not working with "GET /rest/api/2/issue/{issueIdOrKey}" anymore

fields.description:
The option to add issues to epics is now missing on Agility Projects as stated in [Get started with agility boards|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirasoftwarecloud/get-started-with-agility-boards-945104903.html]

 
h2. Add issues to epics

Epics represent larger pieces of work to be broken down and completed over a long period of time. To assign an issue to an epic:
 # Hover over an issue.
 # Select *more* (*•••*).
 # Select *Add to epic*.

Issues can only be part of one epic at a time.

 

There is a feature request for this which can be seen at [JSWCLOUD-17084|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSWCLOUD-17084], however; I believe this is a bug for new Agility Projects as the documentation states we can do this.
fields.summary: Add issues to epics is missing on Agility

fields.description:
h3. Summary

For agility projects, roadmaps is a feature that is turned on by default. 
For issue configuration, customers can rename their 'epic' issue type to be whatever they want in case there is no epic issue type, then we'll ask in-product if they want to add this in so that they can use the roadmap. 

Users can decide if they want to add a new epic issue type or 'convert' an existing issue type into an epic, but there is no turning back.
If a customer accidentally convert an issue type, he/she can't undo this.
 !convert-1.png|thumbnail! 
 !convert-2.png|thumbnail! 

 !Roadmap.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Navigate to the appropriate board
# Select an issue and in the "Attachments" field the details won't load

h3. Expected Results
* Customer would be able to 'undo' the action 

h3. Actual Results
* No option to revert the action  
 !Task as Epic.png|thumbnail! 


h3.Workaround
# create a new issue type (which is guaranteed to be a story-level type) 
# then delete this wrong epic type (that was accidentally converted) and move all issues to the newly created type
# rename this 'new' issue type as the old one that you've deleted.
fields.summary: Jira Roadmaps: no option to revert 'Epic' issue type

fields.description:
*Summary*
When working on Active Sprints, JIRA show an error when the user moves an issue to an status and immediately try to move to another status. If the user wait some seconds to move the Issue again, it works.

*Steps to reproduce*
1. Move an Issue to a status
2. Immediately move the Issue to a new status
3. An error is shown.

*Expected Results*
The Issue should be moved to another status without the error message.

*Actual Results*
JIRA show an error message.

*Workaround*
Wait some seconds to could move the Issue for the new status.
fields.summary: Error when moving Issues in Active Sprints

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When creating sprint's with 0's in the name I.E Sprint 01, Sprint 02 the 0 is dropped when clicking "Create Sprint" resulting in Sprint 01, Sprint 2, Sprint 3.   This causes issues when sorting in programs like Excel.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
Create sprints named Sprint 01, Sprint 02
Click "Create Sprint"

h3. Expected Results
New sprint is named Sprint 03 (preserves 0's in name)
h3. Actual Results
Actual: new sprint is named "Sprint 3"
 h3.Workaround
Manually edit the sprint name to include the 0 in front of the number.

fields.description:
h3. It is not possible to remove a fix version from an issue once that fix version is archived (this is still true in JIRA v7.5.3).

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Issue are not being shown in Agility board when users add new column in the last column.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Have an Agility project with some issues in it
# Move some issues to all columns (To Do, In Progress and Done)
# Wait until 14 days (without updating any issues) and all issues in Done column will disappear (expected behavior). (/)
# Now, add a new column and make it as the last column in the board called "Closed"
#*  !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 
# Create an issue in the last column

h3. Actual Results

According to [Get started with agility boards|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirasoftwarecloud/get-started-with-agility-boards-945104903.html]:
{quote}
The last column of your board is always the resolution column. This means that:
* If you have sprints enabled: When you complete a sprint, these issues won't return to the Backlog.
* If you don't have sprints enabled: These issues will automatically be archived after 14 days.{quote}
Based on the above, Done column will no longer be the last column hence, the issues should be showing up. But, the issues in Done column are still hidden.

h3. Expected Result

Issues in Done column should be showing up since it's no longer the last column in the board.

h3. Notes

If this is an intended behavior, please update the documentation to provide more details on this kind of scenario.

h3. Workaround

Perform any update to the issues in Done column.
fields.summary: Issue are not being shown in Agility board when a new column added

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When attempting to add an issue via REST API:

{code}
/rest/agile/1.0/sprint/<SPRINT_ID>/issue
with body "{"issues":["ISSUE-KEY"]}
{code}

to a sprint whose originating board has been deleted, it results to an HTTP 400 error: "_The requested board cannot be viewed because it either does not exist or you do not have permission to view it._"

*Steps to replicate*
# Create a new Scrum board
# Create a sprint in that board and note its ID
# Delete the board
# Attempt to add an issue to the sprint using the public REST API,  i.e.:
{noformat} 
/rest/agile/1.0/sprint/{SPRINT_ID}/issue
with body "{"issues":["ISSUE-KEY"]}
{noformat}

h3. Background
Sprints are global entities that exist across many boards, even if its originating board has been deleted.

This feature works fine with server.

h3. Workaround
None
fields.summary: Cannot add issues to a sprint when originating board has been deleted

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Switching of sprint order from one board affects another board. 

h3. Environment

h3. Steps to Reproduce

- Create 2 Scrum boards that are display the same project issues.
- Create Sprint X and assign some issue
- Setup the order of future sprints in the Backlog of Board #1
-- Sprint X
-- Sprint A
-- Sprint B
- Setup the order of future sprints in the Backlog of Board #2
-- Sprint X
-- Sprint 1
-- Sprint 2
- In Board #2, move the Sprint 1 and Sprint 2 to the Top
-- Sprint 1
-- Sprint 2
-- Sprint X

 !Sprint Setup.png|thumbnail!   


h3. Expected Results

The order of the Sprints in Board #1 should remain the same.

- Sprint X
- Sprint A
- Sprint B


h3. Actual Results

The order of the Sprints in Board #1 is affected by the changes on the Board #2

- Sprint A
- Sprint B
- Sprint X

 !Sprint Board1.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Switching of sprint order from one board affects another board

fields.description:
h3. Fix:

Perform a re-integration for the DVCS account:
 # Click on the tripple-dot menu
 # Select to delete the account
 # Confirm to delete the account
 # Click on "Link Bitbucket Cloud account"
 # Go through the installation process

From Bitbucket:
 # Select the account you want to integrate with Jira
 # Go to Settings > Find Integrations
 # Look for the Jira integration
 # Select Add and enter your Jira url
 # Go through the installation process

Once any of these is done, the Bitbucket Cloud account will be synchronized again and the information should be up to date in the development panel when viewing an issue in Jira.
h3. Summary

Development panel is not getting updated with Pull Requests and Commit information from Bitbucket.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Connect Jira with a Bitbucket cloud repository
 # Perform a commit in Bitbucket and put a Jira Issue Key in the commit message.

h3. Expected Results

The commit should reflect in the development panel of the Jira issue.
h3. Actual Results

The commit is not reflecting in Jira.
h3. Notes

This is also affecting Pull requests information.
fields.summary: Development panel not updated with data from Bitbucket

fields.description:
h3. Issue description
By having a board filter with fix version condition, if the fix version is no longer available the board does not load, returning status 500 with java NullPointerException error.

h3. How to reproduce
# Create a board
# Create a release (Release name: A)
# Update the board filter to display issues with this fix version 
** (project = xxx AND fixVersion in ('A') ORDER BY Rank ASC)
# Delete or Merge or Edit the release name
# The board will no longer load and status error 500 is displayed

h3. Expected results
Should be prompted an error regarding the filter of the board to update the fixVersion condition

h3. Actual results
Page does not load and error 500 is thrown at the console
Also, by accessing the filter through Filters page, its not possible to edit it, the page returns the same 500 error.

h3. Workaround
Recreate the releases from the filter and the board will load again
Edit the filter to do not include the deleted/merged releases and save it
You can delete those releases again.
fields.summary: By having a board filter with fix version condition, if the fix version is no longer available the board does not load

fields.description:
*Environment Details* :
Browser : Firefox (tested against 35.0.1)
OS : Redhat or Ubuntu (tested against Ubuntu 14.0.4)
JIRA 6.8.4
Agile 6.7.7

*Issue*: 
JIRA Agile consumes common keyboard shortcuts in Firefox

*Steps to Reproduce:*
- Open 3 tabs in Firefox
- Browse to an Agile board (I used the example scrum board) on the first tab and ensure you're on planning
- Press alt + 2 to switch to the next tab in Firefox

*Outcome*
You'll find that you've just changed to the active sprint rather than the second tab

*Expected Results*
It would be expected that you would land on the second tab open in Firefox
fields.summary: JIRA Agile should not collide with the tab number keyboard shortcuts in Firefox
